com.habitsoft.kiyaa.util
Class FocusGroup

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
              com.habitsoft.kiyaa.util.FocusGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesFocusEvents, Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, Collection<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, EventListener, List<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, RandomAccess
public class FocusGroup
extends ArrayList<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesFocusEvents

Wrap a group of widgets which can receive focus. This serves two purposes above and beyond the built-in focus support: 1. We can programmatically advance focus within the group by calling focusNext() 2. We can check whether any member of the group has focus, i.e. to check whether a particular panel currently has focus.

See Also:
